Girmi007 is right DO NOT DOWNLOAD! the sound has problem!!

The sound doesn't have a PROBLEM, it works fine and the film is watchable because of that. However, it is extremely LOW QUALITY.

The bit rate info says 'AAC 196kbps 48KHz 6channel', which works out to be 32kbps per channel (and sounds that way or worse). This is unacceptable for a Blu-Ray rip. It should at least be in 2ch stereo at around 196kbps.

Fortunately the video quality is good, but the audio should be stereo at that size or matched with one of those awful 350mb film rips for people who don't care and put up with piss poor AV.
